summary: This document is a July 8, 2019 letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office requesting the unsealing of Indictment 19 Cr. 490 against Jeffrey Epstein, followed by the court's order granting the request. It marks the public initiation of the 2019 federal prosecution of Epstein.

persons.name: Henry Pitman

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual named as the defendant in the sealed indictment (19 Cr. 490) which is the subject of the unsealing request.

events.title: Unsealing of Epstein Indictment 19 Cr. 490
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office requested and obtained a court order to unseal the federal indictment against Jeffrey Epstein, making the charges public.

keyFacts: On July 8, 2019, the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York moved to unseal a federal indictment (19 Cr. 490) against Jeffrey Epstein.
The indictment was under seal prior to this request, indicating the investigation and charges were not yet public.
The case is designated as a 'Wheel C' case, a term related to the court's case assignment system.
The indictment references charges under 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking) and 371 (conspiracy).
Magistrate Judge Henry Pitman granted the government's request, ordering the indictment to be unsealed.
